resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

wesm commented on issue #4697: WIP ARROW-5735: [C++] Update winflexbison version for Windows
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4697#issuecomment-505689927
 
 
   This seems actually to be a Boost-related issue
   
   ```
   -- Found Boost 1.70.0 at C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/cmake/Boost-1.70.0
   --   Requested configuration: QUIET COMPONENTS regex;system;filesystem
   -- Found boost_headers 1.70.0 at C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/cmake/boost_headers-1.70.0
   -- Found boost_regex 1.70.0 at C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/cmake/boost_regex-1.70.0
   --   libboost_regex.lib
   -- Adding boost_regex dependencies: headers
   -- Found boost_system 1.70.0 at C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/cmake/boost_system-1.70.0
   --   libboost_system.lib
   -- Adding boost_system dependencies: headers
   -- Found boost_filesystem 1.70.0 at C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/cmake/boost_filesystem-1.70.0
   --   libboost_filesystem.lib
   -- Adding boost_filesystem dependencies: headers
   -- Boost 1.58 found.
   -- Found Boost components:
      regex;system;filesystem
   -- Boost include dir: 
   -- Boost libraries: 
   ```
   
   Here is from a passing Boost build:
   
   ```
   -- Boost version: 1.69.0
   -- Found the following Boost libraries:
   --   regex
   --   system
   --   filesystem
   -- Boost include dir: C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/include
   -- Boost libraries: C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/libboost_regex.libC:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/libboost_system.libC:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/libboost_filesystem.lib
   ```
   
   It looks like Boost 1.70.0 is the culprit
   
   https://ci.appveyor.com/project/wesm/arrow/builds/25537882/job/x8m8m38yy1qm4k2a?fullLog=true#L373
   
   I'm going to try pinning to see if it fixes the build

wesm commented on issue #4697: ARROW-5735: [C++] Pin boost-cpp=1.69.0 to fix MSVC builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4697#issuecomment-505692599
 
 
   Pinning Boost 1.69.0 seems to have done the trick, 1.70.0 must have been getting held back because of a constraint in the dependency graph until sometime today. We'll have to create a follow up issue to figure out why Boost 1.70.0 doesn't work properly with our Thirdparty build scripts

   This caused a Boost warning -> build failure
   
   ```
   FAILED: src/arrow/flight/CMakeFiles/arrow_flight_testing_static.dir/test-util.cc.obj 
   C:\Miniconda36-x64\Scripts\clcache.exe  /nologo /TP -DARROW_FLIGHT_EXPORTING -DARROW_STATIC -DARROW_USE_SIMD -DARROW_WITH_BROTLI -DARROW_WITH_BZ2 -DARROW_WITH_LZ4 -DARROW_WITH_SNAPPY -DARROW_WITH_ZLIB -DARROW_WITH_ZSTD -DBOOST_ALL_NO_LIB -DGTEST_LINKED_AS_SHARED_LIBRARY=1 -DPROTOBUF_USE_DLLS -DURI_NO_UNICODE -DURI_STATIC_BUILD -D_CRT_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS -Isrc -I..\src -IC:\Miniconda36-x64\envs\arrow\Library\include -Iuriparser_ep-install\include -Igoogletest_ep-prefix\src\googletest_ep\include -I..\thirdparty\hadoop\include /DWIN32 /D_WINDOWS  /GR /EHsc   /EHsc /bigobj /W3 /wd4800 /wd4996 /WX /MP /MD /Od /UNDEBUG /showIncludes /Fosrc\arrow\flight\CMakeFiles\arrow_flight_testing_static.dir\test-util.cc.obj /Fdsrc\arrow\flight\CMakeFiles\arrow_flight_testing_static.dir\arrow_flight_testing_static.pdb /FS -c ..\src\arrow\flight\test-util.cc
   C:\Miniconda36-x64\envs\arrow\Library\include\boost/process/detail/windows/wait_group.hpp(55): error C2220: warning treated as error - no 'object' file generated
   C:\Miniconda36-x64\envs\arrow\Library\include\boost/process/detail/windows/wait_group.hpp(55): warning C4244: '-=': conversion from '__int64' to 'int', possible loss of data
   [514/678] Building CXX object src\arrow\flight\CMakeFiles\arrow_flight_shared.dir\server_auth.cc.obj
   [515/678] Building CXX object src\arrow\flight\CMakeFiles\arrow_flight_static.dir\protocol-internal.cc.obj
   ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
   (arrow) C:\projects\arrow\cpp\build>goto scriptexit 
   ```
   
   My guess is this is legitimate https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/arrow/builds/25544786/job/0cxpoyj723a06qb9

fields.summary: [C++] Appveyor builds failing persistently in thrift_ep build

comments.body: For whatever reason, this seems to be mostly happening on the ApacheSoftwareFoundation Appveyor project but not on Appveyor builds on contributor forks. Perplexing

This seems to be Boost-related

{code}
-- Found Boost 1.70.0 at C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/cmake/Boost-1.70.0
--   Requested configuration: QUIET COMPONENTS regex;system;filesystem
-- Found boost_headers 1.70.0 at C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/cmake/boost_headers-1.70.0
-- Found boost_regex 1.70.0 at C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/cmake/boost_regex-1.70.0
--   libboost_regex.lib
-- Adding boost_regex dependencies: headers
-- Found boost_system 1.70.0 at C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/cmake/boost_system-1.70.0
--   libboost_system.lib
-- Adding boost_system dependencies: headers
-- Found boost_filesystem 1.70.0 at C:/Miniconda36-x64/envs/arrow/Library/lib/cmake/boost_filesystem-1.70.0
--   libboost_filesystem.lib
-- Adding boost_filesystem dependencies: headers
-- Boost 1.58 found.
-- Found Boost components:
   regex;system;filesystem
-- Boost include dir: 
-- Boost libraries: 
{code}

Thrift is failing due to the empty include dir

This is probably related with boost-cpp upgrade on conda-forge.

Working build (1.69.0):
https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/arrow/builds/25522758/job/ehs3hy3u04y1elyt?fullLog=true
Failing build (1.70.0):
https://ci.appveyor.com/project/ApacheSoftwareFoundation/arrow/builds/25549313/job/j9ri5xfxufcpat7t

What's weird is that the latest commits date back to June 13:
https://github.com/conda-forge/boost-cpp-feedstock/commits/master

[~xhochy]
Perhaps a subtle change in conda's dependency resolution algorithm... First build has conda 4.6.14, second has conda 4.7.5.
The problem here is that this is picking up Boost's new CMake config which we cannot ingest. We need to disable this using {{-DBoost_NO_BOOST_CMAKE=ON}}
